This guide is a simplified overview of all the Changed in the [[Discovery Update]] ({{BE}} 1.1.x releases), which assumes at least some familiarity with the [[Ender Update]] (''Bedrock Edition'' 1.0.x releases).

==Mobs==
===New===
{|{{Simple Guide table|New Mobs}}
|-
|[[Llama]]
|{{animate|Creamy Llama Revision 1.png; White Llama Revision 1.png; Brown Llama Revision 1.png; Gray Llama Revision 1.png|128px}}
{{animate|Baby Creamy Llama Revision 1.png; Baby White Llama Revision 1.png; Baby Brown Llama Revision 1.png; Baby Gray Llama Revision 1.png|128px}}
|Spawn in mountains.
|
{{Drop|Item|Leather|0|2}}
* {{xp|1|3}} (when killed by a [[player]] or tamed [[wolf]])
* Anything equipped, such as {{blockLink|carpets|link=Carpet}} or a {{blockLink|chest}}.
|Provide a slightly less expensive item transport system.
|-
|[[Illagers]]
|[[File:Vindicator JE1 BE1.png|128px]]
[[File:Evoker JE1 BE1.png|128px]]
|Found in woodland mansions.
|
[[Vindicator]]:
*{{xp|5}} (when killed by a [[player]] or tamed [[wolf]])
{{Drop|Item|Emerald|0|1}}
{{Drop|Item|Iron Axe|0|1}}
[[Evoker]]:
*{{xp|10}} (when killed by a [[player]] or tamed [[wolf]])
{{Drop|Item|Totem of Undying|1}}
{{Drop|Item|Emerald|0|1}}
|
* Being relatives to the villagers, they look similar but have pale gray skin and wear dark clothes.
* Two kinds of Illagers are introduced: evokers and vindicators.
|-
|[[Vex]]
|[[File:Vex JE1 BE1.png|128px]]
|Summoned by evokers.
|
*{{xp|5}} (when killed by a [[player]] or tamed [[wolf]])
|
* Spawn only when summoned by an evoker.
* Appear similar to ghosts, in that they are small, pale, flying mobs that can phase through blocks.
* Show red marks when about to attack.
* Attack players and villagers.
* Hold an iron sword in their main hand.
|-
|[[Librarian]]
|[[File:Librarian.png|128px]][[File:Baby Librarian BE.png|128px]]
|Spawn in [[village]].
|N/A
|
* Added as a new librarian career.
** Trading with a cartographer is the only way to obtain the new explorer maps.
|}

|[[Shulker box]]es
|{{Animate|White Shulker Box JE1 BE1.png; Light Gray Shulker Box JE1 BE1.png; Gray Shulker Box JE1 BE1.png; Black Shulker Box JE1 BE1.png; Brown Shulker Box JE1 BE1.png; Red Shulker Box JE1 BE1.png; Orange Shulker Box JE1 BE1.png; Yellow Shulker Box JE1 BE1.png; Lime Shulker Box JE1 BE1.png; Green Shulker Box JE1 BE1.png; Cyan Shulker Box JE1 BE1.png; Light Blue Shulker Box JE1 BE1.png; Blue Shulker Box JE1 BE1.png; Purple Shulker Box JE1 BE1.png; Magenta Shulker Box JE1 BE1.png; Pink Shulker Box JE1 BE1.png|84px}}
|
{{Crafting
|head = 1
|showdescription = 1
|name = [[Shulker Box]]
|B1 = Shulker Shell
|B2 = Chest
|B3 = Shulker Shell
|Output = Shulker Box
|type = Decoration block
}}
{{Crafting
|ingredients = Any [[Shulker Box]]+<br>Corresponding to [[Dye]]|Shulker Box; Any Shulker Box|Matching Dye
|Output = Matching Shulker Box
|Olink = Shulker box

|type = Decoration block
|foot = 1
}}
|Shulker boxes can be destroyed using any tool or with bare hands, but using a [[pickaxe]] is fastest.
|
* New container.
* The contents of the container will be retained after destruction.
* Can be used to save storage space on the rest of the containers.
|-
|[[Frosted ice]]
|{{Animate|Frosted Ice BE1.png; Frosted Ice 1 JE1 BE1.png; Frosted Ice 2 JE1 BE1.png; Frosted Ice 3 JE1 BE1.png|84px}}
|Spawns walking on water using shoes with [[Frost Walker]].
|Mining with a tool enchanted with [[Silk Touch]] will drop nothing, while destroying frost ice in other ways will turn it into [[water]].
|Breaks after a few seconds, allowing players to create temporarily bridges across water.
|-
|[[Magma block]]
|[[File:Magma Block BE1.gif|84px]]
|Naturally generated in the Nether.
|Magma blocks can be mined with any kind of [[pickaxe]]. If mined without a pickaxe, it will not drop items.
|Causes damage to non-nether creatures standing on top of it.
|-
|[[Bone block]]
|{{Animate|Bone Block (UD) JE1 BE1.png; Bone Block (NS) JE1 BE1.png; Bone Block (EW) JE1 BE1.png|84px}}
|Occurs naturally as part of [[fossil]].
|Bone blocks can be mined with any pickaxe. If mined without a pickaxe, it will drop no items.
|Can be used to store [[bone meal]].
|-
|[[Nether wart block]]
|[[File:Nether Wart Block JE1 BE1.png|84px]]
|
{{crafting
|head = 1
|A1 = Nether Wart
|A2 = Nether Wart
|A3 = Nether Wart
|B1 = Nether Wart
|B2 = Nether Wart
|B3 = Nether Wart
|C1 = Nether Wart
|C2 = Nether Wart
|C3 = Nether Wart
|Output = Nether Wart Block
|type = Building block
|foot = 1
}}
|Nether wart blocks can be harvested using any tool or with bare hands.
|100% non-disassembly, therefore for decorative purposes only.
|-
|[[Red nether bricks]]
|[[File:Red Nether Bricks JE1 BE1.png|84px]]
|
{{Crafting
|A2 = Nether Wart
|B2 = Nether Brick
|A3 = Nether Brick
|B3 = Nether Wart
|Output = Red Nether Bricks
|type = Building block
}}
|Red nether bricks can be mined with any pickaxe. If mined without a pickaxe, nothing will be dropped.
|Can be used as decoration.
|}
